intro: Cyrtandra kaniensis, commonly known as the Kani Island heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
